author: frangio_
content:
is my understanding right that this item in the stack validation procedure is not strictly necessary, because it will be checked at runtime?

> 2.ii. For CALLF and JUMPF check for possible stack overflow: if stack_height_max > 1024 - types[target_section_index].max_stack_height + types[target_section_index].inputs, validation fails.

moreover the actual stack height at runtime will be larger than stack_height_max so this static check seems like it's not doing anything significant. would you consider removing it?

author: gumb00
content: Yes, it would work without it, because there's runtime check anyway, but it's kind of optimization, we check at validation as much as we can, not allowing code on-chain that is guaranteed to fail

author: kuzdogan
content:
Hi all, here's the EIP draft for the metadata section as discussed in the last call: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9100/files
